page.title: 08GRAVEL PITS
page.content: There are{6 gravel pits}in our patch,three near Chadwell,two near West Tilbury,and one near Linford.The one near Linford is very large and covers an awful lot of land,about 0.5-0.75 of a square mile.The gravel in the pits is used for making roads,cement etc.When used for making cement the gravel is mixed into the ballast.Gravel comes in all shapes and sizes,the smallest is{10mm}in diameter then{20mm then 40mm}then 75mm.The 20mm stone is the most commonly used of the four sizes.The big pit at Linford is used by most local sand and gravel merchants.There are also two small{clay pits}in our patch,they are each side of the pit east of West Tilbury.There is a lot of clay in the mud at Tilbury so they are expanding all the time.
